objects.name: Analytic 0233
objects.description: Execution of container orchestration commands (e.g., `docker exec`, `kubectl exec`) or API-driven interactions with running containers from unauthorized hosts or non-standard user contexts. Defender sees programmatic or interactive command execution within containers outside expected CI/CD tools or automation frameworks, often followed by file writes, privilege escalation, or lateral discovery.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: Execution of container management CLIs (docker, crictl, kubectl) or interpreted shells (sh, bash, python) within container context

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: docker:events
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: exec_create: docker exec events targeting running containers from non-CI sources

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:apiserver
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: create/exec: Kubernetes API calls to exec into containers or create pods from curl, kubectl, or SDK clients

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: AWS:CloudTrail
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: CreatePod: Programmatic creation of new pod resources using container images not seen before in the environment

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:audit
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Shell process (e.g., /bin/sh, /bin/bash) spawned in a container without an interactive session attached (i.e., automation anomaly)

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: List of CI/CD pipeline runners, SRE tools, or cluster mgmt agents allowed to invoke API/CLI commands in containers.
Threshold for alerting on unseen container images pulled and executed. Adjust to reduce noise from frequent deploys.
Temporal window to correlate container exec with shell spawn and network activity (default: 2 minutes).
Set whether shell spawns without TTY or PTY should be flagged — based on org deployment model.
